result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Antonio E Arebalo Jr was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Any assessments, counseling or  treatment as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  ***ALSO $5,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND***   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.  Do not drive at all.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 8-30-2016 SCRAM WAS REMOVED BY ZCI ON 2-26-2016.**
Status conference on October 25, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Antonio E Arebalo in court with attorney Patrick K Ritter. Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.
Def- Was just recently appointed and would be requesting an adjournment. ZCI removed the SCRAM unit on 2-26-2016 and an amended bond was never completed.

BTC: Adjournment granted. Clerk to do an amended bond to reflect the SCRAM unit being removed on 2-26-2016.
